sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"秋天"之意。
means: autumn和fall这两个词的区别在于使用地区的不同，前者为英国用词，后者是美国英语。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词都含有"倒塌"之意。
means: collapse ： 通常指房屋等突然倒塌。
fall ： 一般指由于失去平衡等原因而倒塌，也可作引申用。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都表示"落下，下降"之意。
means: descend ： 通常指沿斜线或斜坡下降。
drop ： 指物体从一定高度落下。
fall与drop同义，指突然或猛烈地降落，但fall也可指任何下落，同高度或形式无关。
sink ： 指在空气或水中垂直下降、下沉。

word_mean: 河段两端之间的水面高程差。
边帮局部岩体突然片落的现象。

sentence.Network_en: Sometimes things have to fall apart to make way for better things.
sentence.Network_cn: 有时候要到达谷底，才会慢慢变好。

sentence.Network_en: Here's an inside tip: The faster you rise, the harder you fall.
sentence.Network_cn: 给你一个小忠告：爬得越快，摔得越疼。

sentence.Network_en: Over a given period, the value of shares will rise and fall.
sentence.Network_cn: 股票的价值在某一特定的时期内会有涨跌。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... independent adj 独立自主的 fall n 秋天；瀑布 expression n 短语；表情.
四年级下册英语单词_百度文库 ... else 别的 fall 落下；降下 fast 快的.
新概念英语单词表带音标（第一册） - 豆丁网 ... slip 滑倒，滑了一脚 fall 落下，跌倒 downstairs 下楼.
剑桥国际英语教程_词汇手册入门级_百度文库 ... dry 干燥的 fall 秋季 favorite 最喜欢的.

list.abs: 初中英语短语大全 ... 34. feel like doing sth. 想要干某事 36. fall asleep 入睡 37. again and again 再三地，反复地.
下降时间(fall time) 一个信号从信号值的90％下降到10％所花的时间。 下拉菜单(pull-down menus) 菜单栏上的菜单。
如果说辐射（fall out）（fallout）系列游戏带来了一股文化的话，那它势必是广义的。黑岛工作室的成员们肯定也不希望“辐射（fall out）”所具有的文化内涵 …
介词短语_百度百科 ... drop out 退出，离队 fall behind 落后 fall out 争吵；结果是.

jx.jx_en_mean: come into conflict with and be undermined by

lj.lj_ly: any commitment of resources is likely to fall foul of government cash limitations.
lj.lj_ls: 任何财力投入都可能与政府现金管制有矛盾。

jx.jx_en_mean: conform with others or with accepted behaviour
jx.jx_cn_mean: 与他人一致；符合行为规范

phrase.cizu_name: fall in (或 out of) love (with someone)

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a series of events or facts) begin to make sense or cohere
jx.jx_cn_mean: （一系列事件或事实）开始明晰（或衔接）起来

lj.lj_ly: once he knew what to look for, the theory fell quickly into place.
lj.lj_ls: 一旦他明白要找的东西，这理论很快就派上用场了。

lj.lj_ly: once he knew what to look for, the theory fell quickly into place.
lj.lj_ls: 一旦他明白要找的东西，这理论很快就派上用场了。

phrase.cizu_name: fall over oneself to do something

lj.lj_ly: critics and audiences fell over themselves to compliment him.
lj.lj_ls: 评论家和观众趋之若鹜地恭维他。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a missile) fail to reach its target
(N. Amer. informal)receive blame or punishment, typically in the place of another person
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)代人受过；当替罪羊

jx.jx_en_mean: break up, come apart, or disintegrate

lj.lj_ly: their marriage is likely to fall apart.
lj.lj_ls: 他们的婚姻有可能破裂。

jx.jx_en_mean: have recourse to when in difficulty

lj.lj_ly: they normally fell back on one of three arguments.
lj.lj_ls: 他们通常借助三个论据之一。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fallan, feallan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vallen and German fallen; the noun is partly from the verb, partly from Old Norse fall 'downfall, sin'

encyclopedia.content: 歌词及翻译（修订完整版） Ina - Fall I gave you all you desired 我愿意给你渴望的一切 All that you needed 你想要的一切 Boy, I provided 亲爱的，献上我自己 I let you into my head 请深入我的灵魂 Into my bed 上我的床 And that’s a privilege 这是你的特权 I had your back at the answers 我已经得到了你的答案 You took the dollars 你选择了钱 I took the chances 我选择了机会 Defended, battled and fought 我们争

entry.def: If someone or something falls, they move quickly downwards onto or towards the ground, by accident or because of a natural force.

example.ex: Her father fell into the sea after a massive heart attack...
example.tran: 她父亲在一次严重的心脏病发作后坠入海中。

example.ex: Prince Charles has again fallen from his horse...
example.tran: 查尔斯王子又一次从马上摔了下来。

entry.def: If a person or structure that is standing somewhere falls, they move from their upright position, so that they are then lying on the ground.

example.ex: The woman gripped the shoulders of her man to stop herself from falling...
example.tran: 这个女人抓住丈夫的肩膀，以免摔倒。

example.ex: We watched buildings fall on top of people and pets...
example.tran: 我们看到一幢幢大楼倒塌，砸在人和宠物身上。

entry.def: When rain or snow falls, it comes down from the sky.

example.ex: Winds reached up to 100mph in some places with an inch of rain falling within 15 minutes.
example.tran: 风力在一些地方达到了每小时 100 英里，15 分钟内降雨量达一英寸。

entry.tran: (常因疲乏)一头倒下，一下躺倒
entry.def: If you fall somewhere, you allow yourself to drop there in a hurried or disorganized way, often because you are very tired.

example.ex: Totally exhausted, he tore his clothes off and fell into bed...
example.tran: 他疲惫至极，扯下衣服，一头倒在床上。

example.ex: In the morning I got as far as the sofa and fell on to it.
example.tran: 早晨，我只走到沙发那儿，就一下子倒在上面。

entry.tran: (数量)减少;(价值)下降;(力量)减弱
entry.def: If something falls, it decreases in amount, value, or strength.

example.ex: Output will fall by 6%...
example.tran: 产量将减少 6％。

example.ex: Her weight fell to under seven stones...
example.tran: 她的体重减到了 7 英石以下。

entry.def: If a powerful or successful person falls, they suddenly lose their power or position.

example.ex: There's a danger of the government falling because it will lose its majority...
example.tran: 政府将因失去其占多数的优势而有倒台的危险。

example.ex: The moment Mrs Thatcher fell from power has left a lasting imprint on the world's memory.
example.tran: 撒切尔夫人倒台的那一刻在世人的记忆中留下了永久的印痕。

entry.def: If a place falls in a war or election, an enemy army or a different political party takes control of it.

example.ex: Croatian army troops retreated from northern Bosnia and the area fell to the Serbs...
example.tran: 克罗地亚军队从波斯尼亚北部撤军后，该地区落入塞尔维亚人手里。

example.ex: With the announcement 'Paphos has fallen!' a cheer went up from the assembled soldiers.
example.tran: 随着一声宣告：“帕福斯陷落啦！”，聚集在一起的士兵爆发出一阵欢呼声。

entry.def: If someone falls in battle, they are killed.

example.ex: Another wave of troops followed the first, running past those who had fallen.
example.tran: 又一批士兵跟着第一批士兵从阵亡者身边跑过。

entry.def: You can use fall to show that someone or something passes into another state. For example, if someone falls ill, they become ill, and if something falls into disrepair, it is then in a state of disrepair.

example.ex: It is almost impossible to visit Florida without falling in love with the state...
example.tran: 去佛罗里达观光而不爱上这个州几乎不可能。

example.ex: 'Business to Business' was taken over by another company after it fell into debt...
example.tran: 《致富》债务缠身，被另一家公司收购。

entry.def: If you say that something or someone falls into a particular group or category, you mean that they belong in that group or category.

example.ex: The problems generally fall into two categories...
example.tran: 问题大致分成两类。

example.ex: Both women fall into the highest-risk group.
example.tran: 两个女人都属于高危人群。

entry.def: If the responsibility or blame for something falls on someone, they have to take the responsibility or the blame for it.

example.ex: That responsibility falls on the local office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees...
example.tran: 那由联合国高级难民署的地方分部负责。

example.ex: A vastly disproportionate burden falls on women for child care...
example.tran: 照料孩子的重担落在了女性身上。

entry.def: If silence or a feeling of sadness or tiredness falls on a group of people, they become silent, sad, or tired.

example.ex: The bus was stopped and silence fell on the passengers as the police checked identity cards.
example.tran: 公交车被拦住了，警察检查身份证时，乘客们鸦雀无声。

entry.tran: (庆典或特别事件)在，适逢(某日)
entry.def: If a celebration or other special event falls on a particular day or date, it happens to be on that day or date.

example.ex: ...the oddly named Quasimodo Sunday which falls on the first Sunday after Easter.
example.tran: 适逢复活节后第一个星期天的名字古怪的“卸白衣主日”

entry.def: When light or shadow falls on something, it covers it.

example.ex: Nancy, out of the corner of her eye, saw the shadow that suddenly fell across the doorway.
example.tran: 南希从眼角的余光里看见突然有个影子落在门道上。

entry.def: If someone's hair or a garment falls in a certain way, it hangs downwards in that way.

example.ex: ...a slender boy with black hair falling across his forehead.
example.tran: 一个身材颀长的男孩儿，黑发垂在额上

entry.def: If you say that someone's eyes fell on something, you mean they suddenly noticed it.

example.ex: As he laid the flowers on the table, his eye fell upon a note in Grace's handwriting.
example.tran: 他把花放在桌上时，目光落在一张写有格雷斯笔迹的字条上。

entry.def: When night or darkness falls, night begins and it becomes dark.

example.ex: As darkness fell outside, they sat down to eat at long tables.
example.tran: 屋外夜幕降临，他们坐到长桌旁开始吃饭。

entry.def: You can refer to a waterfall as the falls .

example.ex: ...panoramic views of the falls.
example.tran: 瀑布的全景

example.ex: ...Niagara Falls.
example.tran: 尼亚加拉瀑布

entry.def: Fall is the season between summer and winter when the weather becomes cooler.

example.ex: He was elected judge in the fall of 1991...
example.tran: 1991 年秋他当选为法官。

example.ex: The Supreme Court will not hear the case until next fall.
example.tran: 最高法院将于明年秋开始审理此案。

entry.tran: 人类堕落(基督教中指亚当、夏娃违反戒律，被上帝逐出伊甸园)
entry.def: In the Christian religion, the Fall was the occasion when Adam and Eve sinned and God made them leave the Garden of Eden.

entry.tran: (摔跤中)双肩着地;(柔道中)体落
entry.def: In some sports such as judo and wrestling, a fall is the act of throwing or forcing your opponent to the floor.

entry.tran: (板球中，三柱门)失陷(指击球员出局)
entry.def: In cricket, when a wicket falls, the team who are fielding get one of the batsmen out.

example.ex: The last seven wickets fell for ten runs.
example.tran: 最后 7 次三柱门失陷得了10分。

entry.def: If something falls open, it opens accidentally.

example.ex: By chance the book beside him fell open to St. Paul's warning to the Romans...
example.tran: 他身旁的书偶然翻开到写着圣保罗对罗马人的告诫那页。

example.ex: The basket that she was carrying fell open.
example.tran: 她提着的篮子忽然打开了。

entry.tran: 卖力;煞费苦心;不遗余力
entry.def: If you say that people are falling over themselves to do something, you mean that they are very enthusiastic about doing it, and often that you disapprove of this.

example.ex: Within days of his death those same people were falling over themselves to denounce him.
example.tran: 他尸骨未寒，还是那些人又大肆谴责起他来。

entry.tran: fall to pieces (英国英语中作 fall to bits) 同 fall apart
entry.def: To fall to pieces, or in British English to fall to bits, means the same as to fall apart .

example.ex: At that point the radio handset fell to pieces.
example.tran: 就在那一刻，无线电遥控器摔得粉碎。

entry.def: If something falls apart, it breaks into pieces because it is old or badly made.

example.ex: The work was never finished and bit by bit the building fell apart.
example.tran: 工程一直没有完工，于是楼一点点地坍塌了。

entry.def: If an organization or system falls apart, it becomes disorganized or unable to work effectively, or breaks up into its different parts.

example.ex: Europe's monetary system is falling apart...
example.tran: 欧洲货币体系正在走向瓦解。

example.ex: I've tried everything to stop our marriage falling apart.
example.tran: 我已竭尽所能去维系我们的婚姻。

entry.def: If you say that someone is falling apart, you mean that they are becoming emotionally disturbed and are unable to think calmly or to deal with the difficult or unpleasant situation that they are in.

example.ex: I was falling apart. I wasn't getting any sleep.
example.tran: 我要崩溃了，我一直都没合眼。

entry.def: If something falls away from the thing it is attached to, it breaks off.

example.ex: Officials say that one or two engines fell away from the plane shortly after takeoff.
example.tran: 官员们说飞机起飞后不久就有一两台引擎脱落了。

entry.def: If you say that land falls away, you mean it slopes downwards from a particular point.

example.ex: On either side of the tracks the ground fell away sharply.
example.tran: 跑道两侧都是很陡的斜坡。

entry.tran: (程度)降低，减弱;(数量、规模)减少，减小
entry.def: If the degree, amount, or size of something falls away, it decreases.

example.ex: His coalition may hold a clear majority but this could quickly fall away...
example.tran: 他的联盟也许会占绝对多数，但这种优势可能会很快丧失。

example.ex: Demand began to fall away.
example.tran: 需求开始减少。

entry.def: If you fall back, you move backwards a short distance away from someone or something.

example.ex: He fell back in embarrassment when he saw that Ross had no hair at all...
example.tran: 看见罗斯的光头，他尴尬地后退了几步。

example.ex: The congregation fell back from them slightly as they entered.
example.tran: 教堂会众在他们进来时稍稍往后退了退。

entry.def: If an army falls back during a battle or war, it withdraws.

example.ex: The Prussian garrison at Charleroi was falling back.
example.tran: 普鲁士驻沙勒罗瓦的部队正在撤退。

entry.def: If you fall behind, you do not make progress or move forward as fast as other people.

example.ex: Evans had rheumatic fever, missed school and fell behind...
example.tran: 伊万斯得了风湿热，没去上课，功课也落下了。

example.ex: Boris is falling behind all the top players.
example.tran: 鲍里斯落后于所有顶级选手。

entry.def: If you fall behind with something or let it fall behind, you do not do it or produce it when you should, according to an agreement or schedule.

example.ex: He faces losing his home after falling behind with the payments...
example.tran: 他没能按时付款，面临着失去房子的危险。

example.ex: Thousands of people could die because the relief effort has fallen so far behind...
example.tran: 因救援工作远远没有跟上，数千人可能面临死亡。

entry.def: If an argument, organization, or person falls down on a particular point, they are weak or unsatisfactory on that point.

example.ex: Service was outstandingly friendly and efficient, falling down on only one detail...
example.tran: 服务态度极佳，效率也蛮高，仅在一个小地方不尽人意。

example.ex: That is where his argument falls down.
example.tran: 这是他论点的薄弱之处。

entry.def: If you fall for someone, you are strongly attracted to them and start loving them.

example.ex: He was fantastically handsome — I just fell for him right away.
example.tran: 他帅极了——我一下子就爱上了他。

entry.tran: 上…的当;受…的骗;对…信以为真
entry.def: If you fall for a lie or trick, you believe it or are deceived by it.

example.ex: It was just a line to get you out here, and you fell for it!
example.tran: 那不过是为了骗你到这儿来的一句谎言，你居然信了！

example.ex: I told him I would think about it and asked for his telephone number. He didn't fall for that one.
example.tran: 我告诉他我会考虑，然后跟他要电话号码。他并没有上当。

entry.def: If a roof or ceiling falls in, it collapses and falls to the ground.

example.ex: Part of my bedroom ceiling has fallen in.
example.tran: 我卧室的天花板有些地方塌下来了。

entry.def: If you fall in behind or beside someone who is walking along, you start walking behind them or beside them.

example.ex: Prentice saw Goss fall in behind the informer.
example.tran: 普伦蒂斯看见戈斯走在密探身后。

entry.tran: 赞成，接受(思想、计划、体系)
entry.def: If you fall in with an idea, plan, or system, you accept it and do not try to change it.

example.ex: Carmen's reluctance to fall in with Driver's plans led to trouble.
example.tran: 卡门不愿接受德赖弗的计划，由此引来了麻烦。

entry.def: If you fall in with someone, you become friends with them and start seeing them a lot.

example.ex: At university, Taylor had fallen in with a small clique of literature students.
example.tran: 在大学里，泰勒曾经频繁参与一个文学小团体的活动。

entry.def: If something falls off, it separates from the thing to which it was attached and moves towards the ground.

example.ex: When your exhaust falls off, you have to replace it.
example.tran: 如果你的排气管脱落，应将其更换。

entry.tran: (程度)降低，减弱;(数量、规模)减少
entry.def: If the degree, amount, or size of something falls off, it decreases.

example.ex: Unemployment is rising again and retail buying has fallen off.
example.tran: 失业率再次上升，零售品购买量下降。

entry.def: If something such as a person's hair or a tooth falls out, it comes out.

example.ex: Her hair started falling out as a result of radiation treatment.
example.tran: 由于放疗，她开始掉头发。

entry.def: If you fall out with someone, you have an argument and stop being friendly with them. You can also say that two people fall out .

example.ex: She fell out with her husband...
example.tran: 她与丈夫闹翻了。

example.ex: Mum and I used to fall out a lot.
example.tran: 我和妈妈过去经常争吵。

entry.tran: (责任、职责、机会)落到…的头上;应由…做
entry.def: If a responsibility, duty, or opportunity falls to someone, it becomes their responsibility, duty, or opportunity.

example.ex: He's been very unlucky that no chances have fallen to him.
example.tran: 他很不走运，机会一次也没有落到他头上。

example.ex: It fell to me to get rid of them.
example.tran: 由我来负责摆脱他们。

entry.def: If someone falls to doing something, they start doing it.

example.ex: When she had departed, they fell to fighting among themselves.
example.tran: 她走后，他们便互相打了起来。

means.word_mean: 1. the season when the leaves fall from the trees;
2. a sudden drop from an upright position;

sentences.sentence: "he had a nasty spill on the ice"

means.word_mean: 4. a lapse into sin; a loss of innocence or of chastity;
5. a sudden decline in strength or number or importance;

sentences.sentence: "the fall of the House of Hapsburg"
"the rise and fall of the tides"

means.word_mean: 7. the act of surrendering (under agreed conditions);

sentences.sentence: "they were protected until the capitulation of the fort"

means.word_mean: 8. the time of day immediately following sunset;

sentences.sentence: "they finished before the fall of night"

means.word_mean: 9. when a wrestler's shoulders are forced to the mat
10. a free and rapid descent by the force of gravity;

sentences.sentence: "it was a miracle that he survived the drop from that height"

means.word_mean: 11. a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity;

sentences.sentence: "a drop of 57 points on the Dow Jones index"
"there was a drop in pressure in the pulmonary artery"
"when that became known the price of their stock went into free fall"

means.word_mean: 1. descend in free fall under the influence of gravity;

sentences.sentence: "The unfortunate hiker fell into a crevasse"

means.word_mean: 2. move downward and lower, but not necessarily all the way;

sentences.sentence: "Her hand went up and then fell again"

means.word_mean: 3. pass suddenly and passively into a state of body or mind;

sentences.sentence: "fall into a strange way of thinking"
"she fell to pieces after she lost her work"

means.word_mean: 4. come under, be classified or included;

sentences.sentence: "Vesuvius precipitated its fiery, destructive rage on Herculaneum"

means.word_mean: 7. decrease in size, extent, or range;

sentences.sentence: "The amount of homework decreased towards the end of the semester"
"her weight fall to under a hundred pounds"

means.word_mean: 8. die, as in battle or in a hunt;

sentences.sentence: "Several deer have fallen to the same gun"

means.word_mean: 9. touch or seem as if touching visually or audibly;
11. occur at a specified time or place;

sentences.sentence: "Christmas falls on a Monday this year"
"The accent falls on the first syllable"
"The Qing Dynasty fell with Sun Yat-sen"

means.word_mean: 14. to be given by assignment or distribution;

sentences.sentence: "The most difficult task fell on the youngest member of the team"
"The pressure to succeed fell on the yougest student"
"payments fall on the 1st of the month"

means.word_mean: 18. to be given by right or inheritance;

sentences.sentence: "The estate fell to the oldest daughter"
"The house accrued to the oldest son"

means.word_mean: 20. fall to somebody by assignment or lot;

sentences.sentence: "It fell to me to notify the parents of the victims"
"The estate devolved to an heir that everybody had assumed to be dead"
"The hills around here fall towards the ocean"
"The vase fell over and the water spilled onto the table"

means.word_mean: 24. drop oneself to a lower or less erect position;
25. fall or flow in a certain way;

sentences.sentence: "Her long black hair flowed down her back"

means.word_mean: 26. assume a disappointed or sad expression;

sentences.sentence: "Her face fell when she heard that she would be laid off"

means.word_mean: 29. be born, used chiefly of lambs;

sentences.sentence: "The prisoners fell to work right away"

example.en: Bruno and Tony pulled the job off together,but Tony took the fall.
example.zh: 那事是布鲁诺和托尼一起干的，可是托尼被捕了。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)留作日后打关司或坐牢用的专款

example.en: Robeson set aside a percentage of his taking for fall money.
example.zh: 罗伯逊从他的荷包中留出一部分作为日后吃官司用的钱。

list.explanation: 被捕，被宣判有罪，被判徒刑，坐牢

example.en: The best thief in the city till he fell.
example.zh: 他被捕前是城里最神通广大的窃贼。

example.en: This is your first fall,ain't it?
example.zh: 你这是第一次坐牢，是不是？

auth_sentence.content: The increases followed a fall in output in January.
auth_sentence.res_content: The increases followed a fall in output in January.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The increases followed a fall in output in January.

auth_sentence.content: The caramel will fall in thin strands and set.
auth_sentence.res_content: The caramel will fall in thin strands and set.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The caramel will fall in thin strands and set.

auth_sentence.content: Odo's fall was a long and protracted one.
auth_sentence.res_content: Odo's fall was a long and protracted one.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Odo's fall was a long and protracted one.

Sentence.sentence: Some scientistsmaintain that the changes we are seeing fall within the range of random (无规律的) variation—some years are cold, others warm, and we have just had an unremarkable string of warm yearsrecently—but that is becoming an increasingly rare interpretation in the face of continued and increasing warm conditions.
Its own oil production falls short of demand.
Worst of all, when her son, Ned, fell and injured his knee, she refused to pay for a doctor and spent hours looking for free medical help.

sentences.en: The leaves begin to fall when autumn comes.
sentences.cn: 秋天来临时, 树叶开始落下。

sentences.en: Babies often fall when they are learning to walk.
The barometer is falling.
The wind fell during the night.
The water in the river has fallen two feet.
sentences.cn: 河水水位下降了二英尺。

sentences.en: Darkness was falling fast.
Sudden silence fell.
The enemy strongholds fell one after another.
The city fell.
Her eyes fell before his steady gaze.
sentences.cn: 在他的逼视下, 她双目低垂。

sentences.en: The old house fell into decay.

means.word_mean: (视线等)落在…上，碰巧看见；(目光等)被引向(某物)；朝…方向，(目光)向下

sentences.en: His eye fell on a misspelled word.
sentences.cn: 他的目光落在一个拼错的词上。

means.word_mean: 变坏，堕落；走入歧途；旧时尤指(妇女)失贞，怀孕

sentences.en: She tempted him and he fell.

means.word_mean: 成为, 变为; 进入…状态

sentences.en: One after another, all of them fell asleep.
sentences.cn: 那些人一个接一个地睡着了。

sentences.en: Suddenly he fell ill and ran a high fever.
sentences.cn: 他突然病倒, 发起高烧。

sentences.en: He fell prey to her charms.
He survived a fall of 40 feet.
sentences.cn: 他从40英尺高的地方跌下来没有丧命。

means.word_mean: 下降, 降低, 减少

sentences.en: There was a sudden fall in temperature.
There was a fall in the price of apples.
It's a fall of 60 metres to the foot of the cliff.
sentences.cn: 从这儿到悬崖之底距离60米。

means.word_mean: 陷落; 垮台; 灭亡; 没落

sentences.en: Pride goes before a fall.
The fall of the city followed heavy bombardment.
sentences.cn: 城市受到猛烈轰炸后沦陷。

sentences.en: That debate led to the government's fall.
sentences.cn: 那场辩论导致政府垮台。

sentences.en: The play was about the fall of an honest man.
sentences.cn: 那个剧本描写一个诚实的人堕落的故事。

jushi.english: Her face fell when I told her that she was defeated in the game.
jushi.chinese: 当我告诉她她在比赛中被击败了,她脸上露出沮丧的表情。
他一个不小心跌倒,摔了个倒栽葱。

jushi.english: Eve tempted Adam and he fell.
jushi.chinese: 夏娃诱惑亚当,于是他堕落了。
